div.l: And sauh a lytel shymeryng / of the lyht
For at an hole / in shon the mone bryht
And bi that lyht she sauh hem both too
But sikyrly she nyst / who was who
But as she sauh / a whit thyng in hir eye
And when she gan / this whyt thyng espye
She wend the clerk / hadde wered a voluper
And wyth the staf / she drouh ay neer and neer
And wend haue hit / this Aleyn̄ at the fulle
And smot the myller͗e / on the pyled skulle
That doıı̄un he goth / and cryde herraw y dye
Thes clerkes beet hym wel and let him lye
And greythen hem / and took her hors a non
And eek her mele / and on her wey thei gon̄
And at the mylle dore / eek they toke her cake
Of half a busshell flour wol wel y bake
Thus is the proude myller / wel y bete
And hath y lost the gryndyng of his wheet
And payed for the souper euerydell
Of Aleyn̄ and of Iohn / that beet him wel
His wyf is swyved / and his douhtir als
Loo what it is a myller to be fals
And therto this proverbe / is seid ful soth
Hym thar nat wene wel that evil doth
A gylour shal him self / gyled be
And god that sit in his Mageste
Save al this companye grete and smale
Thus haue y quyte the myller / in my tale
Explicit fabula prepositi
⁊et Incipit prologus coqui
